docs.snippet: That Ellen, she used to be such a nice girl....
docs.lead_paragraph: Jennifer Hudson strutting her stuff on the cover of Vogue magazine is one thing, but now there's Ellen DeGeneres on the cover of W Magazine's March issue, wearing a turquoise wonderbra and showing something not usually associated with her: cleavage.
docs.abstract: That Ellen, she used to be such a nice girl.

docs.snippet: Defamer reports that Fox Searchlight is pushing the frontiers of Oscar marketing into ever smaller niches, giving out cupcakes in West Hollywood eateries. The Bagger, who has no vote but a strong interest, is holding out for "Babel" M & M's, a bag...
docs.lead_paragraph: Defamer reports that Fox Searchlight is pushing the frontiers of Oscar marketing into ever smaller niches, giving out cupcakes in West Hollywood eateries. The Bagger, who has no vote but a strong interest, is holding out for "Babel" M & M's, a bag of multi-hued candy with a side of portent.
docs.abstract: Defamer reports that Fox Searchlight is pushing the frontiers of Oscar marketing into ever smaller niches, giving out cupcakes in West Hollywood eateries. The Bagger, who has no vote but a strong interest, is holding out for "Babel" M & M's, a bag of multi-hued candy with a side of portent.

docs.snippet: Dozens of Oscar statues magically appear in Times Square and the Bagger is there to greet them....

docs.snippet: The five live-action films in this anthology of Oscar-nominated shorts tend toward sentiment and slickness....

headline.kicker: Movie Review | '2006 Academy Award-Nominated Short Films'
headline.content_kicker: Movie Review | '2006 Academy Award-Nominated Short Films'

docs.snippet: Tom Hanks, Academy member and Oscar winner, ain't talking....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Baguette ran into Tom Hanks at the Odeon, down in TriBeCa, last night. He was attending the after-party for "Starter for 10," a romantic comedy produced by Playtone Productions, Mr. Hanks's company, and HBO Films. The film, which opens Feb. 23, is about a working-class kid in 1985 (James McAvoy from "The Last King of Scotland") who is obsessed with appearing on a TV quiz show called "University Challenge" and who falls for his beautiful teammate (Alice Eve).
docs.abstract: Tom Hanks, Academy member and Oscar winner, ain't talking.

docs.snippet: Another award, another data set for Oscar Ninnies....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Bagger likes the whole Oscar data set as much as the next Ninny, but he is a piker compared to the real veterans. Over at OscarWatch, the Editors Guild awards, which will be handed out this weekend, are undergoing shaking and baking for all sorts of implications. Not need to know, but nice to know.
docs.abstract: Another award, another data set for Oscar Ninnies.

docs.snippet: The keeper of Oscar memories says its time to go....
docs.lead_paragraph: Newbies like the Bagger often have to depend upon the kindness of relative strangers, and one of the people who has patiently borne the brunt of the his witless inquiries is John Pavlik, spokesperson for the Oscars. After 39 Oscar shows -- he once watched John Wayne cry like a baby after getting an Oscar -- Mr. Pavlik is moving on.
docs.abstract: The keeper of Oscar memories says its time to go.

docs.snippet: Fun Oscar facts for all ages....
docs.lead_paragraph: If you want a tutorial in all things Oscar -- the Bagger audited the class last year -- you might want to click around at "How Stuff Works." Fun fact to forget? The oldest Oscar winner was Henry Fonda, at 76, for "On Golden Pond."
docs.abstract: Fun Oscar facts for all ages.
